definition[0]: a strong and unreasonable desire to do something
example[0]: The desire to laugh became a compulsion.
example[1]: Leith felt an overwhelming compulsion to tell him the truth.
example[2]: the compulsion to smoke or eat too much
definition[1]: the act of forcing or influencing someone to do something they do not want to do
example[3]: The use of compulsion in psychiatric care cannot be justified.
example[4]: Owners are under no compulsion to sell their land.
